Posts.Content: labhusky wrote: I had dcis before.  Now getting the results from the dr this morning, he said that it was t2, he got it all in the excisional biopsy.  Now, I have a masectomy in my future for prevention plus he would take nodes, test one to see if I need chemo or not (I hope not), then possible reconstruction at the same time.  I had radiation with the dcis so this would be the next step.  Since the cancer is out its like lets hurry and get this done immediately so we are talking a month at least.  In the meantime, he will send me to a plastic surgeon to discuss the reconstruction.  A lot of questions for you all.   Anything to worry about having a masectomy, what are the chances no lymph nodes would be involved (he took the nipple with this biopsy so its more twd the front and original incision at 3:00 area left breast).  What is reconstruction like.  Hurt with a masectomy at the same time.  Drains uncomfortable?  Only wear a week?  How long out of work? Sorry, my head is spinning, and I worry a lot.  I probably will have to take a pill but I can handle that.  But how long, like 5 years again but not tamoxifen because the surgeon I would get something like aroma based (sorry I know thats not the right spelling).  Are they any good? Dx 9/13/2007, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 2/7/2015, IDC, Left, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 11/21 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ (IHC) Chemotherapy 5/5/2015 Taxotere (docetaxel) Targeted Therapy 5/6/2015 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 5/27/2015 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: just diagnosed again need opinions like crazy labhusky Msqueen57

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2007 11:55AM labhusky wrote: I start radiation tomorrow.  Sometimes, I get eczema on my hands and I am fair skinned.
Posts.Title: Radiation Induced-Dermatitis LeeSilsby labhusky

Posts.Content: labhusky wrote: I had a left mastectomy last tuesday after my excisional biopsy on 2/9.  It was stage 2a and went up to stage 3c because of the number of lymph nodes removed.  I just got my pathology report yesterday.  It says  stage 3c, pt2, cmx.  The her-2/neu by IHC  OVEREXPRESSION (HUH?).  Ki-67 unfavorable 26.8% another huh?   Well my surgeon said  Id need chemo and that when I see my onc on the 28th he will tell me the same thing.  Guys, Im terrified.What if I dont get it ?  Im scared if I do and may be scared if I dont.  I have a job.  Am I going to be able to do anything at all?  Am I going to have to live in the emergency room or worry about going there alot?  Stage 3c scares me.  What are my chances of survival?  So scared! My two drains are out so at least I feel free in that respect.  Help! Dx 9/13/2007, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 2/7/2015, IDC, Left, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 11/21 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ (IHC) Chemotherapy 5/5/2015 Taxotere (docetaxel) Targeted Therapy 5/6/2015 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 5/27/2015 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: scared to death the 2nd time around labhusky MaryJC

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2008 04:23PM labhusky wrote: Hi Purple, Ive been following your plight here.  I think thats absurd that they MADE you change your appointment.  I tend to be a rebel and would think that if all these people are off, one more wont matter.  I would tell them," my health is important to me and that it should be important to you also.  Otherwise without it, I WOULDNT be here AT ALL."  Sorry, just a rant here.  I hate waiting and tend to get impatient and so worried.  My worry drives me nuts. Hang in their Purple, you are just like the rest of us believe me!!!
Posts.Title: very very scared! purplequeen purplequeen
